posts.post_content: This card more than any other gave me pangs about the M10 combat damage changes. There was little I enjoyed more than spreading counters to all creatures my opponent sent to take down [Inescapable Brute](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inescapable Brute) and then dropping this Knight onto the table. I'm glad it got its day in the sun (or whatever they have in Shadowmoor) before damage assignment became more strictly regimented.
posts.html:

There was little I enjoyed more than spreading counters to all creatures my opponent sent to take down Inescapable Brute and then dropping this Knight onto the table. I'm glad it got its day in the sun (or whatever they have in Shadowmoor) before damage assignment became more strictly regimented.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: JamesLucas (3/31/2011 5:57:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This turns normally powerful situations on creatures into a huge drawback.
  
[Kazandu Blademaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kazandu Blademaster) is colouring in his corner.
  
Artifact creatures pumped with [Steel Overseer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Overseer) are now rusting.
  
Anything you happily [Contagion Clasp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Clasp)ed or even [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine)d are sick in bed.
  
It's very powerful, and if its toughness weren't in bolt range (but notice not [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) fodder),
  
I'm confident we'd see him being played frequently.
posts.html:
This turns normally powerful situations on creatures into a huge drawback.
Kazandu Blademaster is colouring in his corner.
Artifact creatures pumped with Steel Overseer are now rusting.
Anything you happily Contagion Clasped or even Contagion Engined are sick in bed.
It's very powerful, and if its toughness weren't in bolt range (but notice not Doom Blade fodder),
I'm confident we'd see him being played frequently.

posts.post_content: I love using [Brighthearth Banneret](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brighthearth Banneret) after the first few turns to lock down someone's power creature. I also use [Hateflayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hateflayer) with [Arcane Teachings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcane Teachings) along with this guy to lock multiple creatures down as well as beat face. Yes, much more efficient ways of doing this, but I use what I have.
posts.html:

Posted By: hedronMatrix (5/30/2011 10:32:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is such a beastly card...against a Simic deck (if anyone out there plays with one still) it would basically make it useless. And yes, so many good combos to make with it. It'll definitely be a target for [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)s and such, but as Black, you'll find ways to get it back to your hand/in play from the graveyard :)  
  
Edit: Also, this combined with [Gnarled Effigy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gnarled Effigy) and [Blowfly Infestation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blowfly Infestation) can work wonders.
posts.html:
This is such a beastly card...against a Simic deck (if anyone out there plays with one still) it would basically make it useless. And yes, so many good combos to make with it. It'll definitely be a target for Lightning Bolts and such, but as Black, you'll find ways to get it back to your hand/in play from the graveyard :)

Edit: Also, this combined with Gnarled Effigy and Blowfly Infestation can work wonders.

posts.post_content: No one mentioned it yet but in Block, there is [Meadowboon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Meadowboon). I had a deck with those two and [Soul Snuffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Snuffers). It was quite a fun casual deck. You could also Meadowboon an ally's creatures or your own for persist purposes. [Pyrrhic Revival](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrrhic Revival) worked well in there too.
posts.html:
No one mentioned it yet but in Block, there is Meadowboon. I had a deck with those two and Soul Snuffers. It was quite a fun casual deck. You could also Meadowboon an ally's creatures or your own for persist purposes. Pyrrhic Revival worked well in there too.
